content:
The security says that server could return 401/403/404 for access denied.
The http does not list 403 as a server's status code column.
I know this has been back-and-forth between 401 vs 403.
Should both be listed here as per security page indicated?
are we looking at the FHIR core spec http.html page as a constraint on http? I have seen it as guidance on http, not a forbidding of things in the http standard.
there are many http response codes that a client must be able to handle, and a server should be able to use when it is necessary. right?
I agree with John, http calls could result in a wide variety of status codes not specified by the FHIR spec.
Note: this table lists the status codes described here, but other status codes are possible as described by the HTTP specification.

actually the whole note makes it even more clear

Note: this table lists the status codes described here, but other status codes are possible as described by the HTTP specification. Additional codes that are likely are server errors and various codes associated with authentication protocols. The security page notes several security related issues that may impact which codes to return.
That make sense. Thank you @John Moehrke @Paul Church
Yunwei Wang has marked this topic as resolved.
